revised_title: The Role of Sir William Grove in the Reform of the Royal Society
tldr: This article discusses the significant role of Sir William Grove in the reform of the Royal Society in 1847. Grove's proposal to limit the number of Fellows elected each year to fifteen was adopted, which helped to improve the Society's focus on scientific progress. Grove's contributions to the field of energy conservation are also highlighted.
